 What YOU can do Change the way you travel Embracing sustainable transportation practices is key for reducing carbon footprints. Opting for greener alternatives like walking, biking to campus, carpooling, and using public transportation can significantly reduce emissions. Challanges Select your primary mode of transportation Bus Jeep Car Motorcycle Tricycle Next Start by answering a few questions. 
Your responses will give us a rough estimate of your carbon emissions. 

Remember, there are no right or wrong answers. It’s not about perfection 
but about guiding your next steps for action. 

Ready?
Thank you for your answers! 
Your insights will help us understand your 
impact and guide you in reducing
 your carbon footprint. 

Let’s keep making a difference together! Save Changes 
 Masugid Enterprise 
 
 Hello there! "Machuritto" Enquiries can be directed to: \@masugid_enterprise masugidenterprise2b@gmail.com Masugid Enterprise is a student-led business from Quezon City University (QCU) offering churros with a unique twist—served with creamy matcha. 

This venture combines the popular snack of churros with a rich, smooth matcha flavor, appealing to those who enjoy classic treats with a modern, flavorful upgrade. Masugid Enterprise Wani Enterprise “Sa-WAFF Panalo” Wani Enterprise, run by Quezon City University (QCU) students, offers unique, savory waffles for an affordable 25 pesos each. With flavors like asado and adobo, the business blends Filipino-inspired tastes with the popular waffle format, aiming to provide a satisfying and budget-friendly snack for students and the local community. \@wanienterprise 0951-003-5060 
 
 
 
 Playmaker Enterprise Playmaker Enterprise “Langka-Tulad, Langka-Pantay at 
Langkasing-Sarap na Jack of Pie” Playmaker Enterprise is established by a group of students from Quezon City University, pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Entrepreneurship, with a shared vision and determination to make a meaningful impact in the culinary landscape. Drawing upon their academic background and passion for entrepreneurship, the students saw an opportunity to leverage their skills and creativity to create a business that not only generates profits but also makes a positive difference in their community.

With a focus on serving delicious pies infused with the unique flavors of jackfruit, the students recognized the potential to introduce something innovative and distinctive to the market. Their choice of jackfruit as a main ingredient reflects not only their desire to offer something unexpected and delightful but also their commitment to supporting local agriculture and promoting sustainability. Challenge yourself now! C-Verde collaborates with Masugid, Wani, and Playmaker to promote sustainability through user engagement. Users can earn discounts or vouchers by participating in challenges and when users reach specific carbon emission reduction goals. The potential larger discounts are redeemable green products from the enterprises.
<![CDATA[Privacy & Terms 1. Acceptance of Terms Privacy & Terms Ensuring that the information you provide is accurate and up-to-date. Regularly updating the app to benefit from new features and improvements. 4. User Responsibilities You are responsible for: C-Verde collects and processes personal information, such as your daily activities, energy usage, and travel habits, to calculate your carbon footprint. 3. Data Collection and Privacy Avoid any unauthorized access, tampering, or reverse engineering of the application. • Use the app for lawful purposes and in compliance with all applicable laws. • Provide accurate data regarding your activities to ensure accurate carbon footprint tracking. C-Verde is a carbon footprint tracker that allows users to monitor and reduce their environmental impact. By using the application, you agree to: 2. Use of the Application By downloading, installing, or using the C-Verde application, you agree to be bound by these Terms and Conditions. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use the application. Last Name POINTS: 85 Collect points to redeem special awards Your Total Carbon Footprint: 0.00 g CO₂ Walking Bike LOGOUT About
C-Verde C-Verde c.verde0101@gmail.com 
 
 
 " C-Verde is an innovative mobile application designed to help individuals monitor and reduce their carbon footprint in an accessible way. By tracking daily activities like transportation, electricity usage, food consumption, and waste generation, " 
 To reduce food waste, start by planning your meals and creating a grocery list to avoid impulse buys. Store food properly in airtight containers, and label leftovers with dates. Practice portion control when serving meals and get creative with leftovers. Your Challenges Take daily actions to reduce your carbon footprint, earn rewards for each completed challenge, and build sustainable habits. Let’s create a greener future together! In Progress

COMPLETED Day 2: Unplug for Energy Savings Challenge Goal: Reduce your carbon footprint by choosing plant-based meals instead of meat. Day 1: Go Meatless for One Day! Start Challenge Challenge Goal: Unplug electronics when not in use to reduce energy waste. Day 3: Carry a Reusable Water Bottle Challenge Goal: Use a reusable water bottle instead of buying plastic ones.. Day 4: Plan a Zero-Waste Meal Challenge Goal: Use ingredients you already have at home to prepare a mea Day 5: Digital Declutter Challenge Goal: Delete old emails and files from your devices and cloud storage. DONE Later Eating plant-based meals instead of meat significantly reduces greenhouse gas emissions, conserves water, and lowers energy use associated with food production. By opting for plant-based alternatives, you can make a tangible positive impact on the environment while exploring diverse, nutritious, and delicious food options. -10 kg CO2 (-0.21% of your footprint) COMPLETED Challenges "
You've successfully completed Day One of the challenge and earned points. Thank you for making the effort to stay green! " -10 kg CO2 Many electronics continue to consume energy even when turned off, a phenomenon known as "phantom" or "standby" power. By unplugging devices such as chargers, appliances, and entertainment systems when they’re not in use, you can significantly cut down on unnecessary energy consumption, lower your carbon footprint, and save on electricity bills. This simple habit can make a big difference in reducing overall energy waste.

This challenge helps build sustainable habits while contributing to energy conservation and reducing unnecessary environmental impact. Single-use plastic water bottles contribute significantly to pollution and landfill waste, taking hundreds of years to decompose. By switching to a reusable water bottle, you reduce plastic waste, minimize your carbon footprint, and help conserve resources. It’s an easy and effective way to stay hydrated while supporting a more sustainable lifestyle.

This challenge not only reduces plastic waste but also encourages healthier hydration habits. Instead of buying takeout or extra groceries, this challenge encourages you to get creative with what’s already in your pantry, fridge, or freezer. Not only does this reduce food waste and save money, but it also promotes resourcefulness and helps you discover new ways to combine ingredients. By using what you have on hand, you can create delicious, budget-friendly meals while minimizing your environmental footprint.

This challenge helps you minimize food waste, save money, and make the most of what’s already in your kitchen. Over time, old emails and files accumulate, taking up unnecessary space on your devices and cloud storage. By organizing and deleting outdated or unused files, you can improve device performance, make it easier to find important information, and reduce your digital footprint. This challenge encourages digital decluttering, helping you stay organized while contributing to more efficient use of storage resources.

This challenge helps you maintain a cleaner, more organized digital environment while improving device efficiency and security. 
 Your actions are harming the environment. But it’s never too late to make a positive change! Start by taking on these daily challenges. OK
